intro: Doliocarpus lopez-palacii, commonly known as the Lopez-Palacio's doliocarpus, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. It produces small, round fruits that are typically red or orange when mature. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
